info.title: Cado Platform API
info.description:
The documentation reference for the Cado platform's RESTful API. The API can integrate with every part of the platform, from user management, querying timeline data, and importing evidence from the cloud. We provide some example Python scripts to help you get started.

Using the API requires an API key, which can be obtained from the Cado platform. This API key needs to be used with the `Authorization` header in the Bearer format. For example: Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY.

Each API will have a few extra parameters listed in the description, these parameters describe how the API behaves and what it expects. The parameters we list are:
  • Feature Lifecycle: This indicates if the API is in beta or production. If the API is in beta, you may need to enable it in the Experiments settings inside the platform.
  • Admin Only: This indicates if the API requires an administrator user account.

patch.summary: Update a notification to be read or unread
patch.description: Update a notification to be read or unread.

parameters.name: notification_id
parameters.description: Id of the notification to update

is_viewed.description: Whether a notification has been viewed or not

default.description: A response indicating an error has occurred.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "error".

message.description: The error message returned by the API. In some cases, the message will contain a link to documentation for further troubleshooting.

code.description: An error code that can be given to Cado support for further troubleshooting.

data.description: Any supporting data returned by the API that can help with further troubleshooting.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "success".

id.description: The unique id of the notification model instance

is_viewed.description: Whether the notification has been viewed or not

created.description: Creation time as a Unix timestamp

project_id.description: The unique id of the project

evidence_id.description: The unique id of the evidence instance

get.description: List evidences visible to the current user

parameters.description: Which page or results to return.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: How many results per page.

total_pages.description: An integer representing the total number of pages.

post.summary: Start an import of an EKS container into a specified project.
post.description: Start an import of a running EKS container into the specified project. The container will have Cado Host executed on it in order to grab a triage package. A processing pipeline will be returned that details the status of the processing of the EKS container triage package. Additional setup may be required for authenticating with EKS clusters, see our documentation for details.

externalDocs.description: Additional documentation of the EKS import feature can be found here:

cluster.description: The name of the EKS cluster which contains the container you wish to import.

pod.description: The name of the Kubernetes pod which contains the container you wish to import.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace of the EKS pod which contains the container you wish to import.

container.description: The name of the Kubernetes container that you wish to import data from.

region.description: The AWS region where the EKS cluster is located.

project_id.description: The ID of the Cado project that you want to import the data into.

default.description: A response indicating an error has occurred.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "error".

message.description: The error message returned by the API. In some cases, the message will contain a link to documentation for further troubleshooting.

code.description: An error code that can be given to Cado support for further troubleshooting.

data.description: Any supporting data returned by the API that can help with further troubleshooting.

200.description: A new pipeline object is returned, indicating a successful kick-off of a pipeline. You can see the Pipeline API documentation for information on getting details about this pipeline.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "success".

data.description: The data containing the new processing pipeline.

created.description: Date and Time the pipeline was created at.

evidence_id.description: Evidence ID assigned to the pipeline.

name.description: Name of the created pipeline. In the format of "Acquiring {container_name}"

pipeline_id.description: The numerical ID assigned to the pipeline.

pipeline_type.description: The type of pipeline that was created. This will always be "acquisition".

project_id.description: The ID of the project that the pipeline belongs to.

subtasks.description: A list of subtasks created inside the pipeline.

id.description: A unique identifier given to the created subtask.

user_id.description: The ID of the user who triggered the pipeline.

get.summary: Browse a list of EKS clusters in a specific AWS region.
get.description: Browse a list of EKS clusters in a specific AWS region inside your chosen AWS account. Additional setup may be required for authenticating with EKS clusters, see our documentation for details.

externalDocs.description: Additional documentation of the EKS import feature can be found here:

parameters.name: cloud_id
parameters.description: The alias of the chosen AWS account to browse. See the Clouds API documentation for more info on obtaining the cloud_id for a specific AWS account.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: The AWS region to browse EKS clusters in.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The pointer to the next page given by the response of the previous/current page.

parameters.name: max_items
parameters.description: The amount of items to be given per page. If left blank, the default will be 25.

default.description: A response indicating an error has occurred.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "error".

message.description: The error message returned by the API. In some cases, the message will contain a link to documentation for further troubleshooting.

code.description: An error code that can be given to Cado support for further troubleshooting.

data.description: Any supporting data returned by the API that can help with further troubleshooting.

200.description: A successful response, containing a list of EKS clusters.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "success".

data.description: The data containing the list of EKS clusters

clusters.description: A list of EKS cluster names

pagination.description: Pagination information that allows you to browse pages of clusters.

type.description: A string indicating the type of pagination supported by the API. In this context, the value will be "cursor".

current_token.description: A string representing the pointer to this current page.

next_token.description: A string representing a cursor to the next page. Use this in place of the `cursor` attribute to get the next page.

previous_token.description: A string representing a cursor to the previous page. Use this in place of the `cursor` attribute to get the previous page.

get.summary: Browse a list of Kubernetes pods in a specific EKS cluster.
get.description: Browse a list of Kubernetes pods in a specific EKS cluster inside your chosen AWS account. Additional setup may be required for authenticating with EKS clusters, see our documentation for details.

externalDocs.description: Additional documentation of the EKS import feature can be found here:

parameters.name: cloud_id
parameters.description: The alias of the chosen AWS account that the cluster resides in. See the Clouds API documentation for more info on obtaining the cloud_id for a specific AWS account.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: The AWS region that the cluster resides in.

parameters.name: cluster
parameters.description: The name of the EKS container you want to browse in.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The pointer to the next page given by the response of the previous/current page.

parameters.name: max_items
parameters.description: The amount of items to be given per page. If left blank, the default will be 25.

default.description: A response indicating an error has occurred.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "error".

message.description: The error message returned by the API. In some cases, the message will contain a link to documentation for further troubleshooting.

code.description: An error code that can be given to Cado support for further troubleshooting.

data.description: Any supporting data returned by the API that can help with further troubleshooting.

200.description: A successful response, containing a list of Kubernetes pods.

status.description: The status of the response, in this context, the value will be "success".

data.description: The data containing the list of Kubernetes pods.

name.description: The name of the Kuberentes pod.

namespace.description: The namespace of the Kubernetes pod.

pagination.description: Pagination information that allows you to browse pages of clusters.

type.description: A string indicating the type of pagination supported by the API. In this context, the value will be "cursor".

current_token.description: A string representing the pointer to this current page.

next_token.description: A string representing a cursor to the next page. Use this in place of the `cursor` attribute to get the next page.

previous_token.description: A string representing a cursor to the previous page. Use this in place of the `cursor` attribute to get the previous page.

get.summary: Browse a list of Kubernetes containers in a specific EKS cluster.
get.description: Browse a list of Kubernetes containers in a specific EKS cluster inside your chosen AWS account. Additional setup may be required for authenticating with EKS clusters, see our documentation for details.

externalDocs.description: Additional documentation of the EKS import feature can be found here:

parameters.name: cursor
